titlestmt.titleproper: Timothy Chambers Coyne genealogical research files 1992-1997
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Timothy Chambers Coyne genealogical research files
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Timothy Chambers Coyne was a professional genealogist and high school teacher. He lived in Huntingdon Valley, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of genealogical research on various families. Materials include notes, newspaper clippings, family charts, correspondence regarding the research, copies from published and primary sources, and family charts. For the Gable family there are also some photographs of headstones and houses.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
